p: In this study, steam distillation was used to extract M. didyma EO, and GC-MS and GC-FID were used to analyze the composition of the EO. The antibacterial, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory activities of M. didyma EO in vitro was assessed and results compared with the positive control Thymus vulgaris [ 24]. The objective of this study was to substitute standard antibiotics with M. didyma essential oil, although the main compounds responsible for the biological activities were identified and the effects of M. didyma EO on the growth performance, feed intake, and feed efficiency of mice and broilers were then evaluated.
